Nordstrom Inc. JWN, -2.62% family members are in talks with private equity partners including KKR & Co., Apollo Global Management and Leonard Green & Partners to take the luxury department store private, according to a Reuters report.
Nordstrom operates 354 stores, including 221 Nordstrom Rack off-price locations, and 122 full-line stores in the U.S., Puerto Rico and Canada.
The S&P 500 index SPX, -2.33% is up 10.2% for 2017 to date, and the SPDR S&P Retail ETF XRT, -3.73% is down 6.3% for the period.
Nordstrom has also approached sovereign wealth funds, public pension funds and others in an effort to raise about $1 billion.
The Nordstrom family has agreed to offer preferential terms to these potential partners, Reuters wrote.
Nordstrom shares are up 3% in late Thursday trading and up nearly 3% for the year so far.
